Our first Lincoln was an LS, good car except rear wheel not good in the north county in winter and seats were not comfortable, the Zephyr seats or great with front wheel drive..This is Lincolns best.........

Review_Title: Went Lincoln over Lexus, Acura, BMW
Review: I was going to pickup a BMW a couple months back, until I drove the Zephyr. I am very impressed with everything about it. Gets lots of looks, but its not gaudy. Lincoln has a notion of sophistication.  Everything from Cooled/Heated seats, automatic Up/Down widows, comfortable seats and high quality seat and dash materials, awesome fit and finish! I drive over 27k per year in city and highway, so I am very stringent on what I buy. Better materials inside than BMW, more power and no 'tin box' feel like Lexus.  This car performs well, shifts are dead-on, steering is tight, lights on and off highway are bright, regular (87) gas, comfortable, very roomy and open feeling. Plus it's American! A+

This car is a very comfortable, nicely equipped vehicle. Itsinterior is well designed. The fit & finish are comparable to any other car. Quiet, smooth ride with a solid feel. Very little lean in turns.

I purchased the Zephyr to replace my Mercury Sable that seems to last forever and just keeps going. Most noticable about the Zephyr is the quiet and comfortable ride. Bumps and road noise have just about disappeared.  I have the standard sound system that seems adequate for FM but is outstanding with CD's. It is embarrassing to get so many stares of approval as I drive around. The trunk is large enough to hold an entire order from Costco with room to spare.  The air conditioned seat makes me feel like my pants are wet, but is quite effective. The air conditioner is quite powerful even in 99 degree weather. My only complaint is that the vision in the rear is poor, like most other 2006/7 cars.

It handles well even on wet roads and has good visibility. My passengers and I love the smooth & quiet ride. I open the trunk, fold down the two back seats, lay a blanket down, and my dog rides to the vet in style. Took him a minute to figure out he had to enter from the trunk but he loves it now.

We purchased our black Zephyr 4 weeks ago and we just love it.  It is a car that you notice on the road, very sophisticated yet sporty. Gas mileage is great both city and highway. Offers a tight drive and comfotable ride.
Without question the best car I have ever owned.  Have had LSs, Town Cars, you name it, FORD has however delivered a winner.

Have had the Zephyr nearly 3 months and have enjoyed it.  I did have to replace the steering whell due to the leather wrap starting to peel off.  Turning radius is average.  The car does have some pep if you get on it.  The steering wheel controls are excellent and allow more freedom to switch radio stations, media, a/c etc. than many competitors.  It's hot in the south, thus the a/c in the seats are awesome.

Although a great driving experience with head turning good looks it is not perfect. Rear vision is a problem and the center arm rest is out of position. It would also be nice to have the steering wheel mounted controls more readable but overall an excellent choice of vehicles. It is my wife's car but I drive it as often as possible.
Great fun car, no problems, relaible, everyone asks what it is and where I got it!
I truly enjoy this vehicle. The ride is smooth and everything about this vehicle says quality. Although it seems that I need to fill the tank every four or so days it's well worth it.

I just traded in my 2004 CTS.  I love the Zephyr.  It DOES have stability, so I dont know why the reviews on Edmunds says otherwise.  That is not true at all.  Also, I hate the fact that Lincoln will change the name to some stupid letter bearing name.  What the hell is that about.  I should be happy though, because my ZEPHYR will be special!

Got this car several weeks ago: the best ride I have ever had.  The design is great, it's a pretty car (my wife loves it), but the creature comforts are awesome. The THX stereo w/17 speakers is the best I have ever had, in or out of the car.  The Navigation system is incredible.  Climate control is as good as it has been for over 10 years on Ford company vehicles.   On top of all that, it is a great ride, with great response, acceleration.  Nimble and fast.  What a car: I can't praise it enough.
styling id great, however the economy thus far does not live up to expectations. we average 22 mpg, even on experssway. can't this be improved?

We traded in our Lincoln Aviator for this car.  We wanted better gas mileage but didn't want to give up any luxury features that the Aviator had.  We didn't have to give up anything, as the Zephyr is loaded.  Classy. We don't feel we've given up any space by trading in our SUV with the large trunk and flip-down seats for more storage.  We opted for the navigation system... nice!  Didn't think we'd use it, but turns out it's a daily use tool.  We average 21 - 22 mpg, with a mix of in city and hwy miles. This is a car that feels sporty, classy, and will turn heads.  Fun to drive and easy controls where they should be placed.

I bought this car from a private owner.   After a few items I bought for looks the engine is great and the ride is just as great.  All of the new cars are way too small and not made for a bad accident.  when I retired I dreamed of having a large car.  There were none available.  I was lucky to find an older car in this shape. Its not perfect but after one hundred thousand miles it is all original and in great condition.
Ford/Lincoln made a great car in the mark 8.

The rated fuel economy must be average city and highway.  When I put it on cruise control at 45mph on the long stretch between Gulf Breeze and Ft. Walton the instant mpg was touching 40mpg.  Cruising at ~70 on the highway usually gets me around 27mpg, lately, and the engine is barely ticking over 2000rpm to do so.  I prefer my old 93 to my 97, though, it seemed to be assembled with a higher standard.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review_Title: She goes with class for sure!
Review: I purchased my leaseback Toreador Red used Mark in 1999.  It had 24,000 mi.  I have run the dickens out of it and she has taken the punishment with ladylike understanding.  She is a beauty today in as much as it was the day it was made. The 4.6 DOHC runs like a scaulded dog. The tranny was a bit slushy at first, but I put in a shift kit and now she'll squal the tires between 1st to 2nd shifts.  I destroyed the first engine and replaced it at my expense at 108Kmi.  The new engine is even stronger than the first, maybe overbored a bit??? This car says luxury from the git-go, and it says successful, fast, and a bit dangerous male or female inside.  My wife also loves it and the heated seats.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I decided to buy a Mark VIII after driving one from NC to CA for a friend that bought the car off Ebay. I took  more than a year to find this car in CA. Most of them are on the east coast it seems. It is a very clean (repainted) two-owner car which had  65k /miles when I bought it 7/2007. The car now has 81k 10 months later. It has had (or has) every single glitch or known problem these cars get. Heater blend door inop, drivers side mirror glass distorted, rear window strip kinked, vibration at 80+ from the driveshaft, rough idle, etc. But everytime I get past a problem and drive the car again, I love it!

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I loved the car. It was very speedy! Parts are way too expensive! I pretty much liked everything about the car. But I think when I bought the car it had been wrecked. So I had abnormal problems.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I also own 94 Tbird, 00 Mustang GT. This is an awesome car. Bought it with 110000 miles on it and it runs great and looks super. The air suspension failed so I put a standard suspenion under it, so it handles better than my GT. It is pearl white and still turns heads after 10 years. Wish Ford would bring it back. Gas mileage is acceptable, 25 mpg on the highway. I would buy a couple more.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: excellent car, had it for almost ten years now, only has about 100,000km on it, and runs great

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This vehicle is truly the high mark of American performance combined with luxurious pampering.  The sleek styling of the exterior combined with the soft leather seats with the computerized status readout truly make this a unique automobile.  The air-ride suspension truly does make you feel like you are floating at times.  The car depreciated from $42,000 (new) to around $7000 (retail), easily making this luxury rocket a value to find.  To me, the Mark VIII will always be the ultimate executive driving machine.

Luxury Hot Rod!  Loved the Mark VIII from day one, knew what they REALLY were, and now own two of them, a '94 and '97. The '97 now has 104k mi. and still doesn't use a drop of oil! The 4.6 Intech is an outstanding motor and combined with the looks, luxury and just plain fun-to-drive factor, I'm  totally satisfied with this car. I don't see much on the road I'd rather own, or that can outperform it. All the accessories work perfectly and the only issues I've had to deal with were the front air bags and the blend door for the climate control.  One thing I don't like is the non-replaceable rear window molding that tends to ripple..otherwise love it.. a lot! Top notch luxo-rod.

Review_Title: Luxury & Style with the Heart of a Snake
Review: A hard-to-find car in this area, I was really stoked when I located my '97 Mark.  It has the extra-cost Ivory Pearescent Tri-coat paint and every option except heated seats.  And with its Mustang Cobra-like powerplant, this luxo-barge will really hop when you press the loud pedal.  Highway manners are excellent, even @ 90.  Have only had to replace a serpentine belt, a coil pack for cylinder #6 and a driver's side low beam HID headlight bulb ($170.00 even with a healthy discount) in 15,000 miles.  Touchy in snow, but worth it during fair weather.  My Mark's been extremely reliable, just wish the cool neon taillight that stopped working didn't cost $700 to replace. Overall great, fast car.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review_Title: Mark VIII LSC / F-15 with wheels(1997)
Review: After owning a 1988 Mark VII LSC for over 160,000 miles and then placating myself (albeit enjoyably) with an Olds Aurora, I bought this car about one year ago over the Internet. My only conditions were: the dealership performed any of the needed work I asked for; and if the car were not up to snuff we would both walk away from the deal without penalty or harshness on either side. It turned out to be the best auto purchase I ever made! Being a Ford/Lincoln dealer they performed their regular pre-owned checks and needed work, and I only had to hold off one of the more unscrupulous salespeople who tried to sell the car out from under the Internet salesperson whom I initially dealt with.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This car is an excellent blend of luxury, performance, great styling and looks (still turns heads after an 8 year run!!). Repairs are NOT cheap, but this is a fact of life with any luxury  vehicle. If you want cheap, buy a Focus! I was able to buy a car in great shape, and not needing mechanical work.I owned a Mark VII from 1992-2002 and was familiar with the model. I have a moderate setup, and am pushing about 300-310 HP. Comfort, speed, and a great JBL sound system!Fiber optics inside are jet cockpit like.! I recommend the LSC for its' upgraded package of suspension and braking. Since it has been discontinued, I shall garage mine. One of Ford's better ideas for sure! Thank you Wixom!!

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: For the $9,200 I payed for my Lincoln I have a great car.  I bought it used and did need to have the transmission ($1400) refurbished, the drivetrain ($500), and alternator ($250), other than that all has been routine maintenance.  The car looks great, especially if you add some nice rims and tint the windows.  The 290 horses under the hood really get the car moving.  I reccommend this car to anyone who enjoys both luxury and performance, as I do.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Power and excellent take off

column1: accelleration. Good car to add
performance items if so inclined. Not a
winner when it comes to handling in
corners and curves due to the softness
of the air bag suspension but it does
squat and go when you want it to. I am
selling a '97 and looking for a low
milage '98 in excellent shape. This car
looks real good on me!

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This is an awsome car. It corners

column1: great. You can be going 100 miles per
hour and not even know it. Really
smooth ride. Very reliable.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This I must say is the best car I have ever owned! Outstanding quality, great toys, and the comfort of a Lincoln. The power is just WONDERFUL and the 4.6 DOHC is the most reliable engine on the planet. I would go out and buy them all up if I had the money!! Buy this car and it will NEVER DISAPPOINT YOU!! The 97-98 Marks were the BEST ever made.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This car has been fantastic,I absolutely love it! I think that the body design is beautiful.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: for a car that was valued at 43,000 new paying 15,000 for it was well worth it just for the luxury alone not counting the performance of the lsc model

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This car has been fantastic.  the 4.6 DOHC is a jem, and has been flawless for the 7 years I've owned it.  If you keep up on th routine things - these cars have outstanding reliabiliy.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: When I first bought my car, I had to spend a few dollars on it. I replaced the driveshaft, HID lights, all 4 tires, the whole steering wheel, the door handles, the brakes and the 10-disc changer. But the good news is, since then (6 months now), I have NOT had ANY problem whatsoever. No other car gives you the feeling a 97-98 Mark VIII gives you. Everywhere I go, compliments abound. People don't know how to think of you. They think you have a lot of class, they think you like power and speed, they think you have a lot of taste. It doesn't matter whether they are girls, guys, young or old.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I bought my 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII in October of last year as my very first car.  Many people couldn't believe I was getting something that nice for my first car, but I absolutely love it! I think that the body design is beautiful. Large xeon headlights for extra visibility and the slight hint of a tire hump accross the trunk lid that relates back to the earlier Mark VIII's are just part of what makes it so wonderful. For the inside, mine has heated seats, which are very rare.  I also like the msg center- You can get on-glance-info on many features and settings.   Overall, I think they're a great car and a blast to drive.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Fabulous Car!  Probably the last Lincoln with any "pizazz".  I would love to pick up a second one , a 98 CE, as a second car!

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: The Mark VIII is a great car

column1: considering how affordable they are
used. The powertrain is
flawless. The motor is strong and very
reliable. The braking and handling are
very good for a 3800 lb car. Interior
is very nice and of high quality
materials. The cars problems are not
that bad or expensive if you take the
time to learn about the car. The HID
bulbs cost about 150$ each to repair
(MUCH more at a dealer). The tranny
requires regular flushes with Mercon V
in order to stay smooth (every 30K).
The air suspension requires new struts
about every 6 years (so about 440$
every 6 years for parts).

Review: Had to get a new alternator and

column1: machined rotor when new pads were put
on.

Review: JUST RECENTLY PURCHASED THIS VEHICLE FOR A GREAT PRICE AND MUST SAY THAT I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT SO FAR! PLENTY OF POWER, RIDE IS VERY PLEASANT EVEN WITH THE 18" RIMS/TIRES I JUST PUT ON. HANDLES SURPRISINGLY WELL FOR A BIG CAR.DEPENDING ON HOW YOU DRIVE THE CAR GAS MILEAGE IS PRETTY GOOD, ESPECIALLY ON THE HIGHWAY AT CRUISING SPEEDS. HEADLIGHTS ARE AWESOME BUT VERY COSTLY IF THEY HAVE TO BE REPLACED.

This car is just a blast to drive.  The handling is amazing and the power never stops coming.  This car has muscle-car performance and hanling while remaining composed, quiet, comfortable, and luxurious in the interior.  With the HID headlamps, side turning lamps, puddle lamps, and neon tail lamps, and optional chrome wheels the exterior looks as good as the interior.  The interior is really set off by the leather sport bucket seats.  The car has a ton of neat features that you'd only expect to find in a Mercedes.

Vehicle_Title: 1997 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review_Title: A perfect car if you can stand the seats
Review: Think of this as a Ford Mustang Cobra for old guys (gals) who want elbow room and an automatic.

The Mark VIIIs are smooth yet quite fast off the line. I love the roomy front interior. The back seating is non-existant. I use it for storage. Gass mileage I get is 24 city 27 highway even in winter months. Excellent highway driving. Came with 10CD changer and JBL stereo which is nice but not great. Handling is very ggod for such a large car. I'd opt for a 98 instead of 97. The 4.6 Ford v8 will run forever under good maintenance.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Mark 8 suffer from poor low beam headlights. There is an easy, quick and cheap fix. Go on line under haedlight conversion hits. There is one out there at $51 and change.  Kit is for all four headlights. Is add imple bulb replacement. New bulbs have attached cooler fan with a pigtail connector. Connector is needed because new lamps are longer and  there is no room to connect the old wires to the new lamps. Pigtail works great and connects easily to old wires. The difference in lighting performance is astounding. If you have a Mark 8 get this kit. Hurry these are not being manufactured anymore.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Awesome styling, fit finish inside/out. Only good thing I have to say for the mark 8. Car has 83k.  Problem after problem. Blown head gasket, (2k in repairs) new low mileage bullet, 1k for engine, 1k for install.  Freaking steering column goes throughthe exhaust manifold, column removal to swap engine.  Blend air door 1k to repair. Door handles made of pot metal, breaks often. 14 mpg city/22 highway. Drive shaft, brakes, elect fail. Ford has no body parts, when found, are high bucks!  My 4 door Buick Ultra v6 (blown) is faster, Mark ran 14.72 quarter mile.  Buick Park Ave 14.38.  What next will fail, air ride, neon tail lamp or HID lamps.  My Collectors Edition is parked, may bring $ 1 day.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Wow!! What a Car. From the moment I drove the car at the dealership, I told my husband, "This is a Hot Rod Lincoln and I want it!" Of course I never thought that I would own one, but bought it brand new 3 months later. We absolutely LOVED THE CAR! Ride is excellent, performance is unbelievable, and the car is absolutely BEAUTIFUL! To this day June 2010 when I drive this car I get compliments on it. It is the Bright Toreador Red Tinted Clear coat Metallic and when clean looks still looks like a million bucks. I love this car, but replacement parts are hard to find so as I sit here today I'm having to sell the car. Believe me the tears will be coming. By far the BEST Car I've ever owned.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Hello everyone, people everywhere who have this car and participate on the online forums for this car knows of me. But for those who don't, I'm ginamarie. I proudly own my 98 Lincoln mark 8 lsc se, I had gotten this car as'a birthday gift from hubs, when I realized it was time to buy something a little more reliable- boy was I right and got exactly what I wanted, blkonblk, moon, low miles got her at 50k and she still going strong at a little over 174k. Like every car with miles you have your leaks and squeaks. As long as you keep your oils changed and up to the min on necessary repairs I know my lsc will go for many more miles.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I too love this car, as someone who's had many cars in my life time this one has been the most fun to drive and I also get many complements from other drivers. For anybody out there who's needing any spare parts theirs a Bone yard in central Florida called Rienharts" they have many of the parts you will ever need plus they will ship it overnight if you wish. my rear center tail light went out a few years ago and they were very helpful, I was surprised who easy it was to install myself in about one hour. I hope this info will help all of you "mark" lovers like myself.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Gonna cost you in repairs but well worth it.I have a Ford mechanic good friend,so it's cheap for me. Cobra motor is getting a new intake and exhaust, hopefully tuning too.Air ride goes bad,rotors warp,small electrical problems,stabilizer bars on front. Set of Blizzaks for winter and 17" Konigs with performance Kumho's for summer.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Fun to drive, reliable, very comfortable, attractive (still draws compliments), well designed.  Almost maintenance-free except for essentials.  Have always had recommended maintenance performed on time. There have been recalls, which have been promptly completed by the dealer with no problems.  Ford has established itself as a quality manufacturer and the dealers provide reputable after-sale service.  I plan to continue driving this car for a long time, one reason being that there is nothing on the market that I would want as a replacement.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Purchased the LSC in 2007 at 112K miles.  Had already had tie rods, links, and front bushings replaced around 70K.  Replaced $400 A/C tube at 122K; wheels around 140K due to excessive corrosion; tie rods and stabilizer links again at 150K.  Powertrain control module went at 155K ($2000).  Ran fine until 175K at which point the PCM went out again.  Can't and won't replace it a second time.  Despite having to put some real money into the car to keep it running I have enjoyed almost every minute of driving.  Its design is centered around the driver and a responsive driving experience.  If you can find one with less than 100K, buy it, drive it, then sell it before it starts to fall apart.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I bought this black beauty in 2004 with 26,000 mi. It still runs like a Bat. with 200,000 mi. I hate ford has not only stopped producing this car , but has hidden all the spare parts. American Auto companies just don't get it. I am now facing some electrical problems and need replacement items like the center tail running light ballast and cannot get it so I had it disconnected.Fuel pump is only available from NAPA now. I was in Atlanta and had to have the pump replaced, so I limped into Pugmire, (Lincoln Dealer) They charged me over $1,000 to fix it and screwed up my exaust pipes so badly, they offered to reimburse me for having someone else repair their work.(where can I find parts?

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I bought it new and have had it ever since. I have never owned an automobile that I love to drive as much as I do My Mark VIII. The first time I drove it on an interstate and it stooped down when I reached 50 MPH, I was hooked. Its pearl paint job looks like it just came off the showroom floor. People still will stop me in parking lots to talk about its beauty. If you ever have a chance get you one
I bought my Lincoln Mark V111 with 200000 miles and it was an awesome investment.  Good car, drives great!

Had for a month, Great solid ride.  Only Avg 17mpg city. Previous owner loved this car. I limo tinted the windows that gives an even more unique look. Just had 2 control arms replaced at 72,000 miles and fluids flushed. Ford Dealer said that was ONLY thing needing to be fixed, that the car is in EXCELLENT shape.  Thats a Dealership folks!!!!  They would laundry list the Repairs to make money!!!  So im VERY Pleased to hear this.  Nice sound system for 11 years old, but WILL add my 2-10" subwoofers in the Back of the trunk.  Trunk is not very DEEP.  Backseat room!? None.  Who cares!!!  Im concerned aftermarket warranty wont cover AIR RIDE suspension.  I guess ill find out! BUT I LOVE THIS CAR!

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review_Title: Great car, wish they still made them.
Review: Bought this Mark with 32,000. Now have 87,000. Replaced both front brake rotors, they warped. Rear neon light ballast went bad and have already replaced both HID headlamps. Also replaced two C.O.P. coils. Air ride pump is starting to sound bad. I own three of these Marks. 1998 Mark VIII LSC (above)  1996 Mark VIII 82,000 miles. Replaced air struts/pump and front brake rotors (warped). 1995 Mark VIII 150,000 miles. Replaced air struts/pump, front brake rotors (warped), transmission shift assembly, and alternator. I really like these cars and wish they still made them. These have been some of the better cars that I have owned. Better than a 2001 Cadillac STS I had owned.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I bought this car from a very nasty divorce situation and the car took the brunt of it. I have have put a lot of money and effort to get this car close to where it should be. It's a "Collector Edition" and it is simply gorgeous. For being a 10 year old car I get compliment after compliment - people think its a new car. There are not many of these on the road so people are not sure what it is. The syling is timeless.

Review_Title: Love this car, after ten years...
Review: It is a classic style that everyone likes and fun to drive. Only major repairs were front ti-rods replaced and finding replacement HID Headlamps which Ford is no longer manufacturing and none to be found. Had to spend $650 for a headlamp retrofit kit, plus $250 labor to have headlights that work. Difficult to find certain parts since Ford no longer makes this vehicle. Shame on Ford!

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Owned two MkVIIs that I drove for many years with few maintenance issues. In fact, I kept the last one 'til the end was in sight because, for me, the MkVIII was just too big to be a coupe. Finally, in 1998, I realized that the car wasn't going to get any smaller. Even worse, it was about to disappear forever. I bought a black/black '98 LSC. For a personal/luxury car, it's still too big for my preference. However, there is no greater luxury/performance car combo for the price available anywhere in the world.  Even the gas mileage is good considering it's 305HP and 4K+ pounds.

Review_Title: A Classic in the Making - my dream car
Review: After wanting one of these cars for the past twenty years or so, I finally got myself one. I have just been diagnosed with a serious ailment, and realized if not now, when?  It drives like a dream, and still reminds me of the magic carpet ride of a Riveria from many years ago. The acceleration and ride are fantastic, and the pure fun of driving her are just fantastic.  Power behind the 32 valve V8 is incredible. I could never have afforded one of these when new, and feel very lucky to have found this one in as great a condition as she is in. I'm going to have much fun driving around as long as I am able.  Minor considerations of suspension, etc. can all be dealt with the right friends.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Wanted one of these cars since they came out, couldn't afford it though( wife and 4 kids). Found this one on a used car lot, when I drove it i found it had a miss on acceleration and the front brakes pulsated. Bought the car replaced all spark plug boots and front rotors. Replaced front rotors and installed ceramid pads. I have one of the best cars int the world.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Very comfortable, fun to drive. I had no problems with the car. I have been very pleased!

What can I say, I just love this car. It's a wonderfully smooth ride around town or on the highway, soaking up potholes with ease.  The V8 provides effortless power at any legal speed. Gas mileage is usually around 25 on the highway, though I've gotten it as low as 22 (fast into a headwind) and as high as 27 (65 w/ a tailwind?) If you're having traction problems in rain or snow, it's your tires.  The first set I had were lousy in rain and snow.  I've since switched to 2 sets of tires- snows for winter and a set of summer performance tires. Repairs since the warranty ran out have averaged about $800/yr, which I'd consider well worth it to drive a Mark.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Bought this Mark with 65000 on it, now have 95000.  It is a good ride for my 170 mi/day commute.  I'm getting over 25mpg on the hi-way.  Car looks great, timeless design.  Drivers seat starting to show wear.  Would have liked to have option to have both cassette and CD player.  back seat pockets are nets, cheaper looking than in 97.  Didn't see significant difference in LSC and standard, didn't feel it driving either.  Guess the dual exaust is about it.  Had to repair the steering wheel, ouch.  thousands of parts many motors, many bucks.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: Combination of features and performance

column1: with this vehicle. Exterior appearance
still looks fresh and the interior
ergonomics are perfect. Very
comfortable for highway traveling.
Despite what others say the car tracks
well in winter conditions. Overall LSC
trim pkg transforms this car into a
luxury vrsion of the Mustang Cobra.
Receive lots of compliments on the
vehicle from strangers.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I bought a 98 Mark VIII LSC in 2000 with only 13K on it.  I always wanted one. I love the cockpit style interior and the teloscopic steering wheeel, and auto adjust seat.  After a preformance chip from lincoln motor sports, and a little TLC she was revin up there.  ran low 14's in the quarter mile.  She now sits in the garage. Being pampered since they wont bring it back out or make a Mark 9 I have to make sure she last for a long time

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I recently purchased a Mark VIII, and i have to tell you that this is the best car i have ever owned. The attention I get from people when they see this car is great. I love everything about this car and wish they still made it today.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII LSC Collectors Ed
Review: This is a very solid, dependable, well-built vehicle that has served my needs for 5 years. It is great on starts and stops and is a really comfortable ride. I still like its design(aircraft cockpit style) and have received many compliments on exterior looks.  It is a unique American luxury car among the ubiquitous German/Japanese models seen all over in Southern California.

I purchased this car for my wife as a present when she received her Masters degree. We had a second child and the Mark VII with a 6 year old and an infant just don't do well together, so she wound up with the SUV and now the Mark VIII is my daily driver.  I love this car.  Yeah, sometimes when it rains, the information center blinks, but big deal. The only significant problem so far after 85K miles has been the blend door on the AC controller.  Cost about 400.00 to fix it. We live on a dirt road and most of the times it is severely 'wash boarded'.  There are NO squeaks or rattles.  This is one solid ride.
This is by far the best car that I have

column1: ever owned. The comfort and ride can
not compare with others in this class.
The power is more than enough for any
condition. The sound system is supurb
and the electronic seats are unmatched.
Highway milage is more than I expected.
I will be using this MARK VIII for my
coffin

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This car is smooth, quiet, economical (25+ mpg highway) yet fast and handles like a big sports car.  All the gadgets like voice command phone, auto lights and mirrors, etc. mean you are not distracted while adjusting or changing settings.    The heated power seats are very comfortable; power tilt/telescope wheel means even at 6'4" I can find a good position and change it occasionally during trips. Sunroof is almost silent when open in vent position at 80mph. Headlights are brighter than anything on the road; the car just begs to find a new, longer way home every night!

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review_Title: why did the stop making Marks!!!!
Review: I have had an 87, a 93 and finally my 89 "collectors" edition (last 1000 made,with fabulous special 2 tone trim and steering wheel from the Jag, which if they started with, might still be making them). Had first 2 built into convertibles with people still gathering sround to admire when sold with 105,000 miles. That would have given LM showroom trafffic, instead of killing it but continue (for a time!) with both the Town Car and Continental which 9 out of 10 couldnt pick apart if they had to. With 82,000 miles, still waiting for first thing to go wrong! There is nothing out there to replace it with (certainly not the LS).

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: First off, this is not a car for everyone.  If you want a perfectly reliable car you never have to think about, buy a Honda.  If you want power, style, luxury, and value, buy a Mark VIII.  If you love cars or have some mechanical ability, you can fix many problems yourself for a reasonable price. I average 22.2mpg in mixed city/highway driving.  I had a worn spark plug boot cause a misfire ($4 part, replaced it myself) and a seat heater went out (not fixed yet).  Otherwise the car has been rock-solid reliable. If you're willing to do a little upkeep, you will love the Mark VIII.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review_Title: One hell of a fine car
Review: I don't drive a whole heck of a lot but

column1: when I do I enjoy every minute of it.
This is the best car I have ever owned
and man is it fun to drive.  Very
comfortable riding car with superb pick
up when it's needed (all the time :)
Never had a single problem with my Mark
VIII LSC  I still get compliments from
people when they see it.

Review: This is a $30K automobile and Ive had nothing but problems.  Wont start and towed 8 times before Ford was able to fix.  Once out of warranty, the repairs exceeded $500 a month.  Largest repair bills were for ignition coils..replace repeatedly...and catalytic converters which went out 2000 miles after the warranty expired.  Cost was $4500.  Burned out headlight was $250, and the ashtray cant be replaced without buying a new console...$2500+. Broken door handle, which didnt last 2 years.  Misc small items which nickle and dime an owner to death. Overall satisfaction with this Ford product is TERRIBLE!!!!

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This is a fun car to drive. Boy, do I get looks when I pass people on the highway. This car has great pickup, is good on mileage. I get an average of 22.3 mpg but on trips I get an average of over 26 mpg consistently. The only poor quality is on long downhill braking from high speeds.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This car's exterior admittedly is not favored by all colors.  In black though (like mine) it looks awesome, and I get many many compliments.  The handling is superb for such a large vehicle.  Reliability for major components has been very good - though there have been some minor annoyances (the exterior door handles are weak and prone to breaking - unacceptable for such an otherwise fine car).  Yes, there are better cars for tens of thousands of dollars more, but overall - there really is NO car for the same money that can match the Mark VIII's total feature/performance package (e.g. 290 hp V-8, air suspension, HID headlamps, cool neon backlight, etc.)

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I am so happy with this car. I owned a 92 Tbird and changing over to the Mark is such a big difference. The newer design front and rear are perfect. The high performance engine is a plus. The cockpit design of the interior looks and feels great. From the telescoping steering wheel, to the easy entry seats, the car is winner in the big luxury sport car class.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This car is a classic.  Great design, great performance - a real road machine.This is my fourth Lincoln, and my third Mark.  Too bad that Ford decided to stop making these luxury coupes.  Have 29000 miles on this car and have had only one minor warranty job done.  Sporty handling and a smooth comfortable ride - city and open road.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This car was an instant collectible when production ceased in 1998.  The Cobra engine makes it a real sleeper and by modifying the intake and exhaust you can make it a 325 hp car.  Gets lits of looks because there aren't many of them.

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: I have had the 98 LSC almost four years.  Several problems but all covered under warranty...and great service at that.It is the "most fun" car I have owned in terms of road comfort, handling, performance, and "eye appeal." Always got a new Linc when more than one day.This sucker runs and runs!Just bought a BMW740 so the wife can haul kids....joy!

Vehicle_Title: 1998 Lincoln Mark VIII Coupe LSC 2dr Coupe
Review: This car is poorly designed. The caps to

column1: the coils are now splitting after 76K miles requiring the entire coil to be replaced because of a design defect and a $5.00 part. The car sometimes acts like the starter is gone. Wouldn't start for 2 days...on the 3rd day it was like nothing was ever wrong.
